title: Week 7: Podcast, Scores, In Case You Missed It
text:
Josh Foley & The Rio Rancho Rams Week 7 Recap 
Today we recap the action from week 6 of the New Mexico High School Football Season. Scroll down to read our entire Week 7 Recap. 
Pictured is the Artesia Bulldogs now 6-1 after beating Alamogordo Friday Night 34-30. 
1. Cleveland - Open The Cleveland Storm are 6-0 entering their open week as they prep for their district opener in two weeks against Santa Fe. The Storm defeated Eldorado in a shootout last week 41-34. On the season they are scoring an incredible 48.3 points per game. 
2. Alamogordo - Lost to Artesia 34-30 Artesia now 6-1, 0-0 in District Alamogordo now 6-1, 0-0 In District Artesia led 14-0 at half 
3. Eldorado - Beat La Cueva 42-3 Eldorado now 6-1, 1-0 In District La Cueva Now 2-5, 0-1 in District Eldo led 21-3 at half 
4. Centennial - Beat Los Lunas 34-14 Centennial now 6-0, 1-0 in District Los Lunas now 3-3, 0-1 in District Hawks led 42-12 at half 
5. Las Cruces - Beat Deming 47-7 Las Cruces now 5-2, 1-0 in District Deming now 3-4, 0-1 in District Bulldawgs led 19-7 at half 
6. Artesia - Beat Alamogordo 34-30 Artesia now 6-1, 0-0 in District Alamogordo now 6-1, 0-0 In District Artesia led 14-0 at half 
7. Volcano Vista - Beat Cibola 23-8 Volcano Vista now 5-2, 1-0 in District Cibola Now 5-2, 0-1 in District Hawks racked up 6 sacks on Cibola 
8. Rio Rancho - Beat Santa Fe 51-0 Rio Rancho now 5-2, 1-0 in District Santa Fe now 0-7, 0-1 in District Rams led 37-0 at the half 
9. Clovis - Beat Grants 49-0 Clovis now 4-3, 0-0 in District Grants now 4-3, 0-0 in District Wildcats snap 3 game losing streak Wildcats led 42-0 at half 
10. Cibola - Lost to Volcano Vista 23-8 Volcano Vista now 5-2, 1-0 in District Cibola Now 5-2, 0-1 in District Hawks racked up 6 sacks on Cibola ...Continue Reading Here 
11. Manzano - Play Sandia Saturday Jumping back into the playoff conversation was Manzano who pulled off a giant upset last week defeating Mayfield 21-17 in Albuquerque to move to 3-3 on the season. ...Continue Reading Here 
12. Mayfield - Beat Onate 31-24 Mayfield now 4-3, 1-0 in District Onate now 2-5, 0-1 in District Onate led 17-0 in the 1st half 
13. Hobbs - Beat Lovington 53-14 Hobbs now 4-3, 0-0 in District Lovington now 1-5, 0-0 in District Eagle QB Isaac Amaya threw for 300-yards & 4 TD's ...Continue Reading Here 
14. Sandia - Play Manzano Saturday Jumping back into the playoff conversation was Manzano who pulled off a giant upset last week defeating Mayfield 21-17 in Albuquerque to move to 3-3 on the season. Quarterback Orlando Perez threw two late touchdowns ...Continue Reading Here 
15. St. Pius X - Play Rio Grande Saturday Still undefeated and still rolling teams on the season, St. Pius X 6-0 is again the big favorite this Friday Night against Rio Grande. Last week Quarterback Drew Ortiz racked up 5 ...Continue Reading Here 
16. Onate - Lost to Mayfield 31-24 Mayfield now 4-3, 1-0 in District Onate now 2-5, 0-1 in District Onate led 17-0 in the 1st half 
17. Valley - Lost to West Mesa 53-44 West Mesa now 2-5, 1-0 in District Valley now 2-5, 0-1 in District Mustang QB Marcos Gonzales threw for 186, ran for 176, scored 6TD's 
18. Roswell - Lost to Moriarty 19-14 Moriarty now 5-2, 0-0 in District Roswell now 4-3, 0-0 in District Moriarty snaps Roswell's 3 game win streak 
19. Farmington - Lost to Piedra Vista 38-20 Piedra Vista now 5-2, 1-0 in District Farmington now 5-2, 0-1 in District Panthers scored 5 Rushing Td's 
20. Piedra Vista - Beat Farmington 38-20 Piedra Vista now 5-2, 1-0 in District Farmington now 5-2, 0-1 in District Panthers scored 5 Rushing Td's 
21. Goddard - Beat Carlsbad 28-26 Goddard now 4-3, 0-0 in District Carlsbad now 0-7, 0-0 in District Rocket's led 14-13 at half 
22. Deming - Lost to Las Cruces 47-7 Las Cruces now 5-2, 1-0 in District Deming now 3-4, 0-1 in District Bulldawgs led 19-7 at half 
23. La Cueva - Lost to Eldorado 42-3 Eldorado now 6-1, 1-0 In District La Cueva Now 2-5, 0-1 in District Eldo led 21-3 at half 
24. Hatch - Beat Socorro 56-6 Hatch now 7-0, 1-0 in District Socorro now 4-2, 0-1 in District Hatch led 49-6 at half ...Continue Reading Here 
25. Espanola Valley - Open One of the bigger mid-season stories of the year has been Espanola Valley Football. The Sundevils are 6-0 for the first time in school history ...Continue Reading Here Talk about it in NEW MEXICO PREP FOOTBALL INSIDER FEATURED PRODUCTS
